Context: The George Brown College Foundation is a separately incorporated registered charity established in 1984 that serves as the primary fundraising vehicle for George Brown College. The Foundation is guided by a volunteer Board of Directors and is located at 200 King Street East, St. James Campus, Toronto, ON M5A 3W8. Key contacts include Cindy Gouveia (President), Gordon Cressy (Senior Advisor), Ana Maria Faria (Director of Development & Communications), Max Ramirez (Manager - Finance & Administration), Oksana Morosovska (Database Manager and Finance Associate), Breanna Roycroft (Senior Development Officer), Alla Steen (Research Officer), Stephanie Rendulic (Development Officer Annual Giving), Alexis Goncalves (Development Coordinator, Donor Relations), Trinity Zhang (Fundraising Development Coordinator), and the George Brown College Foundation. The Foundation raises money to support student success through scholarships, bursaries, and awards as well as larger initiatives that strengthen the College's ability to offer programs for specific industries and professions. No specific program information was mentioned in the text.
